meanings.definition: The action of using someone or something as a model.
meanings.sent1: She practiced her dance moves through imitation of the instructor.
meanings.sent2: The artist created a beautiful painting through imitation of nature.
meanings.sent3: The children played a game of imitation, pretending to be superheroes.
meanings.sent4: His acting was so good, it was like an imitation of the real person.
meanings.sent5: The parrot's imitation of human speech was surprisingly accurate.

meanings.definition: A thing intended to simulate or copy something else.
meanings.sent1: The toy car was an imitation of a real race car.
meanings.sent2: The designer bag was an expensive imitation of the original.
meanings.sent3: The imitation of a famous painting turned out to be a hilarious prank.
meanings.sent4: The artificial flowers were a poor imitation of real blooms.
meanings.sent5: The imitation crab meat tasted surprisingly similar to the real thing.

meanings.definition: The action of pretending to be someone else.
meanings.sent1: During the play, the actor's imitation of the president was spot on.
meanings.sent2: The spy's imitation of a waiter allowed him to gather valuable information.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's imitation of a famous singer had the audience in stitches.
meanings.sent4: Her imitation of her sister's voice was so accurate, it fooled everyone.
meanings.sent5: The child's imitation of a dinosaur was both adorable and hilarious.
